course.title: International History: States, Markets, and the Global Economy
course.faculty_text: Niall Ferguson and Charles S. Maier
course.description: International economic history and political economy, including strategies of economic development, international trade, migration, finance and monetary relations, based on both theoretical works and specific case studies, and focusing on the period from around 1700 to the present.
course.notes: History 1964 and 1965 are designed particularly for advanced undergraduates in the international history track of the concentration and graduate students preparing a general examination field in the history of international relations.
